intro: Eleocharis biocreata, commonly known as the biocreata spike-rush, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in wetland and marshy habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, spike-like clusters of flowers. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, and its rhizomes help it spread vegetatively. Due to its adaptability, it is often found in disturbed or flooded areas, contributing to ecosystem stability.
